com.ibm.mq.badge

Class Cashier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.mq.badge.Cashier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Cashier
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Used to connect to topics and queues to listen for messages and create appropriate responses. Main use of this class is to listen to responses put on a purchase queue and then send a response to a confirmation queue.

    Connection details are provided by the EnvSetter for the current instance of Cashier.

    Some default standards for the message being received should be:

    • XML Format
    • Contains eventID tag - What eventID is being requested.\n
    • Contains numberRequested tag - How many tickets for that event is being requested.
    Author:
    Benjamin Brunyee
    See Also:
    EnvSetter, EventManager

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cashier

        public Cashier(EventManager eventManager,
               EnvSetter envSetter)
        This constructor will provide the Cashier with all the details to make a successful pipeline of information and allow tickets to be through the cashier. Without a EventManager no tickets would be deducted from memory or saved. Without a EnvSetter no details would be provided for the MQ connections.
        Parameters:
        eventManager - The EventManager that will be dealing with ticket subtractions.
        envSetter - The EnvSetter that will be providing MQ connection details.

      • Cashier

        public Cashier()
        Creates the base Cashier. A EventManager will be needed if dealing with requests is the aim. A EnvSetter will also need to be set or this instance as it will provide the Cashier with sufficient details for creating MQ connections.

    • Method Detail

      • getEnvSetter

        public EnvSetter getEnvSetter()

      • setEnvSetter

        public void setEnvSetter(EnvSetter envSetter)

        public EventManager getEventManager()

      • isListeningToResponse

        public boolean isListeningToResponse()
        Checks whether the cashier is ready and is listening for a response to be put on the queue.
        Returns:
        True if the cashier is listening

      • run

        public void run()
        Provides the ability to start this class as a thread for background processing.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • close

        public void close()
        Stops the cashier from listening to anymore messages and moves onto closing the connections that are open for a clean shutdown.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String receiveFrom,
                    java.lang.String sendTo)
        Connects to 2 queues that are specified. The receiveFrom queue is where the Cashier would get its client's requests from. Following from that is the sendTo queue which is the destination of where a response will be sent.
        Parameters:
        receiveFrom - A destination to receive messages from.
        sendTo - A destination to send messages to.

      • waitForRequest

        public void waitForRequest()
        Listens to a queue and waits for a message to be received. When a message is received then it will process the message and create a response to be published to another queue. Desintations are specified in the creation of te Cashier connections.
